data.title: American Samoa Vet Center
data.meta_description: We offer confidential help for Veterans, service members, and their families at no cost in a non-medical setting. Our services include counseling for needs such as depression, post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and the psychological effects of military sexual trauma (MST). We can also connect you with more support in VA and your community.
data.text:
We offer confidential help for Veterans, service members, and their families at no cost in a non-medical setting. Our services include counseling for needs such as depression, post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and the psychological effects of military sexual trauma (MST). We can also connect you with more support in VA and your community.

Main Location

Ottoville Road

Equator Building

Pago Pago, AS 96799

Direct line

Hours

Mon. 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Tue. 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Wed. 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Thu. 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Fri. 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Sat. Closed

Sun. Closed

We also have non-traditional hours that change periodically given our community’s needs. Please call us to find out more.

Need help after hours?

Our call center is available 24/7. Call us anytime at 877-927-8387.

Prepare for your visit

Select a topic to learn more.

Stop by during our office hours and let's discuss how we can help. Many of our services are available on a walk-in basis.

If you would like to schedule an appointment give us a call and we will be happy to discuss a time that works best for you to meet with a member of our staff.

We have a large well-lit parking area. Please feel free to park in any available space.

You do not need to be registered for care at VA, rated for a service connected disability, or receiving any other form of VA benefits. On your first visit, we will look for one or more of the following:

Discharge documents (such as a DD214)

Receipt of certain awards

Deployment orders

Other document that show qualifying military service

Request your military service records online

If you don’t have these documents on-hand, come in and we can work with you to establish your eligibility and also answer any questions you might have.

Bus/Taxi: Tell driver to take you to the Vet Center by the Tradewinds Hotel in Ottoville. We are located on the same property as the hotel. We have a large well-lit parking area, so you can't miss us.

In the spotlight

New Vet Centers and Satellite Locations Announced

To improve access to counseling, we are adding three Vet Centers and six satellite locations across the US and its territories. We will continue to expand our program to meet Veteran demand and provide local support to those who served.

OIF/OEF Support Group

Group counseling for Veterans who served in Iraq and Afghanistan.

To learn more about what we do in group, check out the videos below.

Counseling services

Select a topic to learn more.

We offer couples and family counseling to support you as you work toward meeting your goals.

American Samoa Vet Center has a Licensed Clinical Social Worker onsite to offer family and couples counseling.

If someone close to you has died or you’re adjusting to a difficult life change, we’re here to support you.

If you’re struggling with issues like PTSD, depression, grief, anger, or trauma, we offer counseling and other support. We’ll work with you to help you achieve your personal goals.

American Samoa Vet Center offers individual and group counseling:

Vietnam Veterans Group

Iraq/Afghanistan Group

Recreational Group

Therapeutic activities such as hiking, table tennis, exercise, outdoor activities and events.

If you experienced sexual assault or harassment during military service, we can help you get the counseling you need. Any Veteran or service member, including members of the National Guard and Reserve forces, who experienced military sexual trauma is eligible to receive counseling. This applies to people of all genders from any service era.

If you have symptoms of PTSD after a traumatic event, we can help. We offer assessment and support through private counseling and group therapy. We can also refer you to VA or community counseling for treatment and therapy resources.

American Samoa is very patriotic and is ranked 1st in recruitment into the military per capita. Many Samoans have been involved in wars and various conflicts. Many continue to deal with the impact from their experiences in combat.

If you’re returning from military service, we’ll help you transition to civilian life. We can connect you with educational and career counseling, mental health services, and other programs and benefits that will support your transition.

American Samoa is noted for having the highest rate of military enlistment of any U.S. state or territory. Many Veterans return home and find it challenging readjusting to the island life. The Vet Center can assist in readjustment and improving quality of life.

Referral services

Select a topic to learn more.

We can help you overcome substance use problems, from unhealthy alcohol use to life-threatening addiction. We'll connect you to services for your specific needs.

Call our Veterans Crisis Line at 988 and press 1 to get support anytime day or night. This service is private, free, and available 24/7. Our Vet Center can also connect you with ongoing counseling and services.

We can help connect you to VA and community resources that will support you in achieving your goals.

If you’re returning from military service, we’ll help you transition to civilian life. We can connect you with educational and career counseling, mental health services, and other programs and benefits that will support your transition.

We understand that the transition from military to civilian life can be a challenge. We offer a variety of ways to assist you in that process such as:

How to get VA medical benefits and register for care

Where to go to file claims and other forms

Understanding your VA education benefits

Housing and home loans

Education and referral for VA burial benefits

We can also connect you to Veterans Service Organizations in the community.

Other services

Select a topic to learn more.
